str2: From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To write, send by letter to. From epi and stello; to enjoin, i.e. to communicate by letter.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Probably from phule through the idea of isolation; to watch, i.e. Be on guard; by implication, to preserve, obey, avoid.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of a compound of eidolon and a presumed derivative of thuo; an image-sacrifice, i.e. Part of an idolatrous offering.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
Strangled (i.e. killed without letting out the blood). From pnigo; throttled, i.e. an animal choked to death.
Fornication, whoredom; met: idolatry. From porneuo; harlotry; figuratively, idolatry.
